course.title: Cyberlaw and Investigations
course.catalogDescription: This course introduces the US and international laws on cybersecurity, including law related to privacy, data security, crime, and intellectual property. Students will also explore the implications of culture and international agreements on policy and critical infrastructure. Students will learn the essentials of computer investigations through the application of forensic tools. Cross-listed with SEC455. SEC555 students' grades will additionally depend either on participation in a research seminar project or the score from an approved certification exam (taken during the semester).

textbook.title: Cyberlaw: The Law of the Internet and Information Technology
textbook.author: Brian Craig

objectives.objective: Describe the constitutional foundations of cyber law.
Identify significant national and international laws that relate to cybersecurity.
Interpret intellectual property laws related to security.
Describe major international public policy positions and the impact they have on organizations and individuals.
Summarize nation-specific cybersecurity public policy with respect to the protection of sensitive information and protection of critical infrastructure.
Explain global impact of cybersecurity to culture including areas such as the economy, social issues, policy, and laws.
Discuss various motives for cybercrime behavior.
Summarize terror activities in cyberspace geared toward generating societal fear and uncertainty.
Describe international data security and computer hacking laws.
Describe what a digital investigation is, the sources of digital evidence, and the limitations of forensics.
Describe methods for investigating both domestic and international crimes.
Compare and contrast a variety of forensics tools.
Explain why preserving the chain of digital evidence is necessary in prosecuting cybercrimes.
Describe the concept of privacy including the societal definition of what constitutes personally private information and the tradeoffs between individual privacy and security.
Summarize the tradeoff between the rights to privacy by the individual versus the needs of society.
Describe the common practices and technologies used to safeguard personal privacy.
